content:
Milestone 1 focused on repairing the status quo. I'm now working on milestone 2 which aims to cleanup some internals while avoiding breaking changes. That is because I don't want my work on Lean4-Mode to introduce breaking changes right away. I want users to benefit from active maintenance without any burden.

In the long run, breaking changes are not avoidable for Lean4-Mode because most code is sunken in technical debt (TM) and is in desperate need of a deep refactor. Breaking changes will begin with milestone 3.

The PR for milestone 2 is ready for review. On the way to getting it done, I opened a couple of new tickets and also I had to postpone the ticket "Drop dependency on Dash" because lsp-mode is too deeply coupled to Dash.
Unless I review it today or tomorrow, just merge it.
I won't be available for the next week.
Versions 1.1.0 and 1.1.1 have been released. Check out the changelog for more information: https://github.com/leanprover-community/lean4-mode/blob/master/CHANGELOG.org#version-111
Mekeor Melire has marked this topic as resolved.
